page.title: 19Ecology
page.content: In and around Comber there are little river_bank walks where wildlife flourishes. In the surrounding countryside there are rough patches and swamp areas. Unfortunately, farmers have cut hedges low and used sprays which reduce the bird and animal wildlife but they have spotted their mistake and now are letting hedges grow for shelter. We walked along the old railway track and saw a lot of beautiful flowers and butterflies _ we even had the chance of seeing a butterfly called an{orange tip}. The Council are going to make proper walkways along the river banks so that people can walk their dogs without hearing the noise of the traffic. Recently the River Enler was polluted by a toxic substance but happily we saw a small fish today.
